forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 11pm, then rain and snow between 11pm and 5am. Cloudy, with a low around 31. North wind 9 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of less than half an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 39. West wind 5 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening unfolds in Boston, a subtle symphony of weather begins its performance. Rain gently gives way to snow, intertwining in the air and transforming the landscape into a quiet, atmospheric canvas painted in shades of gray. With temperatures dipping to around thirty-one degrees, the biting chill is accompanied by a brisk north wind that rustles the branches and whispers secrets to anyone brave enough to venture outdoors. The storm holds nothing back, offering a complete hundred percent chance of precipitation, with a delicate new layer of snow accumulating beneath the somber clouds.

Tomorrow brings a promise of clarity, as the clouds will recede, allowing the sun to cast its rays upon the city, lifting spirits and inviting a sense of rejuvenation. With a high near thirty-nine, the day will feel markedly more pleasant. A gentle west wind will carry the fresh perceptions of the day, making it ideal for a leisurely stroll through local parks or a quiet afternoon spent in cozy cafés. Dressing in warm layers is advised—a sturdy coat to ward off the lingering chill, perhaps a charming scarf, and reliable boots will ensure comfort against the remnants of winter’s touch. As the evening settles into an enveloping darkness, consider embracing the warmth of a friendly gathering or the solace of a good book, perfectly reflective of the seasonal shift underway.
